name: Skillet Lasagna
description: Skillet Lasagna is a quick and easy weeknight dinner that will give you all the cozy vibes of a classic lasagna in half the time.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the Italian sausage and olive oil to a large deep skillet. Cook over medium heat until the sausage is cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the Italian sausage and olive oil to a large deep skillet. Cook over medium heat until the sausage is cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Mince the garlic, add it to the skillet with the sausage, and continue to sauté over medium for one more minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Mince the garlic, add it to the skillet with the sausage, and continue to sauté over medium for one more minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the pasta sauce, Italian seasoning, and water to the skillet then stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the pasta sauce, Italian seasoning, and water to the skillet then stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Break the lasagna noodles into one to two-inch pieces, then stir them into the sauce in the skillet.
recipeInstructions.name: Break the lasagna noodles into one to two-inch pieces, then stir them into the sauce in the skillet.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a lid on the skillet, turn the heat up to medium-high, and allow the sauce to come up to a boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a lid on the skillet, turn the heat up to medium-high, and allow the sauce to come up to a boil.

recipeInstructions.text: Once boiling, give the skillet a brief stir, replace the lid, then turn the heat down to medium-low. Let the noodles simmer in the sauce, stirring occasionally, until tender (about 15 minutes). If the sauce becomes too dry before the noodles are tender, add more water and continue to simmer.
recipeInstructions.name: Once boiling, give the skillet a brief stir, replace the lid, then turn the heat down to medium-low. Let the noodles simmer in the sauce, stirring occasionally, until tender (about 15 minutes). If the sauce becomes too dry before the noodles are tender, add more water and continue to simmer.

recipeInstructions.text: While the noodles are simmering, stir together the ricotta, Parmesan, salt, and pepper in a separate bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: While the noodles are simmering, stir together the ricotta, Parmesan, salt, and pepper in a separate bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the noodles have cooked, add the ricotta mixture on top of the noodles in small dollops. Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella over top.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the noodles have cooked, add the ricotta mixture on top of the noodles in small dollops. Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella over top.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the skillet under your oven's broiler for a few minutes or just until the cheese is melted and slightly browned (make sure to use an oven-safe skillet, no lid). Or, place the lid on the skillet and continue to cook over medium-low heat until the cheese is melted. Serve hot and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Place the skillet under your oven's broiler for a few minutes or just until the cheese is melted and slightly browned (make sure to use an oven-safe skillet, no lid). Or, place the lid on the skillet and continue to cook over medium-low heat until the cheese is melted. Serve hot and enjoy!

review.reviewBody: The lasagna never got soft. Kept adding water. Cooked for 30 minutes. Finally ate crunchy noodles.

Easy and delicious. I sautéed mushrooms and onions before adding garlic. Used frozen Italian meatballs from Costco instead of sausage. I put them in the sauce with the noodles to simmer. I had to add water a couple times so it wouldn’t scorch while the noodles finished cooking. Served with roasted broccoli on the side.

Another winner from BudgetBytes ! Went together easily, tasted delicious and preparing with only one pan for clean-up was a bonus. The only change I made was to leave off the mozarella at the end.  The Ricotta/Parm  mixture was just the right amount of cheese for us.
So easy and satisfying to make in hardly any time at all. Don’t skimp on cheap marinara if you’re buying store bought though. No meat necessary.

This was so good! One of my resolutions was to cook for the new year. Made this for my family of four (dad, myself, and two brothers) and it was devoured QUICK. Absolutely do not expect to have leftovers of this dish lol. :,)

I love Budget Bytes recipes, I really do.  But this one was sadly terrible, I won’t make it again.  It was way too thick with the ricotta on top and somehow after I broiled the cheese, the sauce got so thick that it was hard to eat.  We won’t make it again.
Delicious! I love how it's a smaller portion of lasagna. Instead of Italian sausage, I used ground beef according to the comment below.
This is a great base, you can always saute or add veggies (I added onion, bell pepper and garlic). It was lasagna without all the work and since lasagna is my favorite food - this is perfection!

Way easier than traditional lasagna I thought pretty good, husband liked it so much he went for 3rds. the only sub I had to make was 180 Grams dry egg noodles (Aldi didn't have any lasagna noodles!) otherwise followed the recipe as is, would love to try adding some veggies next time to bump the flavors and nutrition.
I made this last night (with a few minor tweaks) and my boyfriend said he liked it better than when I make "regular" lasagna! Soooo good, adding this one to the recipe stack. Yum.

This was amazing! Lasagna is my favorite food, but it can be quite the hassle to make. This was quick, easy, and delicious! To boost the nutritional value, I added 1 cup of frozen spinach (thawed and chopped), one 13 oz can of mushrooms, two bell peppers (orange and red), and half an onion. Will definitely be putting this recipe into the family rotation!

keywords: One Pot Meal, One Pot Pasta, Skillet Lasagna
